Quiz_Questions.question: Are database objects that stores data in a collection of rows and columns
A ____ _____ is a collection of columns.

True or False

First character must be a letter or an underscore ( _ )

True or False

Subsequent characters can be letters, digits, @, $, #, _
Max Column name length is up to ____
Is an attribute that specifies the type of data that the column can store
Consists of any combination of letters, symbols, and numeric characters.
______ - Fixed-length non-Unicode character data with length of n bytes. n must be a value from 1 through 256.
______ - Fixed-length Unicode character data with length of n bytes. n must be a value from 1 through 65,536. SQL Server allocates double the space internally for this type.

_______ - Variable-length non-Unicode character data with length from 1 through 8,000. If no column size define - that is, varchar(), the length will default to 1 can use another setting that can exceed the 8,000-character limit, by defining the data typewith the constant max
________ - The nvarchar type is defined in a similar way to varchar, except it uses Unicode and therefore doublesthe amount of space required to store the data

True or False

Date and time data consists of valid date or time combinations
Hold a date from January 1, AD 1 through December 31, 9999. Theformat is YYYY-MM-DD.
Date and time data from January 1, 1753 through December 31, 9999, to an accuracy of 0.00333 second, storage is 4 bytes
Date and time data from January 1, AD 1 through December 31, 9999,  to an accuracy of 100 nanosecs , storage is 6-8 bytes
Date and time data from January 1, 1900, through June 6, 2079, with accuracy to the minute, storage is 4 bytes.
store a time relative to a specific date and time zone. If you want to store 6 p.m. on March 24, 2008 in US Eastern Standard Time, thevalue would be stored as 2008-03-24 13:00:00 +05:00
hold a time based on the 24-hour clock.  Format is hh:mm:ss[.nnnnnnn].
______ _____ - consists of numbers only. Numeric data includes positive and negative numbers, decimal and fractional numbers, and whole numbers (integers).
______ ____ - consists of negative or positive whole numbers, such as -15, 0, 5, and 2509.
Integer (whole number) data from -2^63 (-9223372036854775808) through 2^63-1 (9223372036854775807). Storage size is 8 bytes.
Integer (whole number) data from -2^31 (-2,147,483,648) through 2^31 - 1 (2,147,483,647). Storage size is 4 bytes.
Integer data from -2^15 (-32,768) through 2^15 - 1 (32,767). Storage size is 2 bytes.
Integer data from 0 through 255. Storage size is 1 byte.
This can contain only a 1 or a 0 as a value (or null, which is no value). It’s useful as a status bit - on/off, yes/no, or true/false, for example
Consists of data that is stored to the least significant digit
The number of digits in a numeric column.
The number of digits to the right of a decimal point in a numeric column.
hold verylarge numbers in the range of –1.79E+308 through 1.79E+308
Can store only numbers in the range of –3.40E+38 through 3.40E+38
Represents positive or negative amounts of money
data type to store values in the range from - 922,337,203,685,477.5808 through +922,337,203,685,477.5
data type to store values in the range from --214,748.3648 through 214,748.3647
is not the same as zero (0), blank, or a zero-length character string such as “”
means that no entry has been made.
use to create a column that contains system-generated sequential values to identify each row inserted into a table
This value is based on a seed value and an increment value

True or False

There can only be one identity column per table : NULL values are not allowed : It can be used with the following datatype: tinyint, smallint, int, bigint or numeric/decimal with a scale of zero
Column or set of columns that uniquely identify each row in a table : It does not allow null values
Column or set of columns whose values match the primary key (PK) in the same or another table
Should be meaningful so as to describe the column content.
Any one of 25 possible definitions provides the basis for the data a column will contain.
For many of the data types, the length is predetermined. Specify a length for character, binary and variable-length data
You can provide an indicator for allowing NULLcontent for any variabl
Enforces unique content for a column and can be used to relate other tables. Must contain a unique non-NULL value
Provides an explanation of the column for documentationpurposes.
Provides a value for a column when one is not explicitly given during data entry.
Inserts a value automatically into a column, based on seed and increment definitions.
Provides the starting value for an Identity column.
Defines how an Identity will increase or decrease with each new row added to a table
